lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: In the deepness of time, before the Ancient Smith formed this world, all was cold and still.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The first spark brought life. Dragons, taking flight. The elves, who hide in their forest palaces. Humans.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: And we carved a place for ourselves. Luteberg, a town of guilds, music, and creation.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But this world is incomplete and long forgotten. Tormented by demons summoned by ancient magics. Hidden by fog.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Our saviours came from the same forge as you or I. Sól, soldier of the sun. Isadora, the Apprentice.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Hand in hand, they cut through the horde to offer us a measure of freedom. And when they cut through the dark, we saw that our tormentors could be killed.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But all things fade. The fog around what once was Luteberg grows ever deeper. Hope fades. Sól disappeared a long time ago. Isadora is lost to chaos now, a maker of cruel dolls.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Those who leave to reason with her do not return.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The demons might be gone but their corruption remains.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But prophecy hidden in dusty books foretells of a pilgrim who will one day break through the darkness and hold the sun once more in their hands...
